meanings.definition: To observe (a day) or commemorate (an event) with ceremonies or festivities.
meanings.sent1: We are celebrating my birthday with a party.
meanings.sent2: The whole town is celebrating the annual festival.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were celebrating with a nut feast.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seem to be celebrating the beauty of the night.
meanings.sent5: The children were celebrating with laughter and joy.

meanings.sent1: The priest is celebrating Mass at the church.
meanings.sent2: The monks are celebrating a sacred ritual in the temple.
meanings.sent3: The birds were celebrating a feathered ceremony in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The waves on the shore seem to be celebrating a divine connection.
meanings.sent5: The worshippers were celebrating with hymns and prayers.

meanings.sent1: She is celebrating her friend's achievements.
meanings.sent2: The fans are celebrating the singer's latest album.
meanings.sent3: The flowers were celebrating the sun's warmth with blooming colors.
meanings.sent4: The wind seems to be celebrating the bravery of the trees.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was celebrating the students' hard work with applause.
